p: A survey of the Cambridge Structural Database (Version 5.38; Groom et al., 2016 ▸) confirmed that the title compound has never been published before. It revealed 51 cyano­metallic structures of the general formula [ TM(H 2O) 2{T M(CN) 4}], where TM = any transition metal. There were also 19 hits for structures containing [Fe{Pt(CN) 4}] fragments: refcodes: OVILEM, OVIRUI, OVIRUI01, OVIRUI02 and OVIRUI03 (Sciortino et al., 2017 ▸), AMIJOX (Kucheriv et al., 2016 ▸), BEDWEO and BEDWIS (Sciortino et al., 2012 ▸), CEMYUQ (Mũnoz-Lara et al., 2013 ▸), MUHMEI, MUHNAF, MUHNAF01, MUHNAF02, MUHPAH and MUHPAH01 (Martínez et al., 2009 ▸), QADDUX (Sakaida et al., 2016 ▸), QOJWIW and QOJWIW01 (Cobo et al., 2008 ▸) and TURXIP (Ohtani et al., 2013 ▸).
